intro: Erythraea pulchella var. altaica, commonly known as the Altai erythranthe, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
